definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: Cuckoos, as a rule, do not build a nest.
In England the cuckoo is the herald of spring.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，杜鹃鸟预告春天的来临。

sentences.english: The cuckoo lays her eggs in other birds' nests.
sentences.chinese: 杜鹃鸟把蛋下在别的鸟的窝里。

sentences.english: Yang bird is the cuckoo, and we all call-yang bird there.
sentences.chinese: 阳雀就是杜鹃鸟，我们那儿都叫阳雀。

sentences.english: There was an implacable logic in the cuckoos' seeming folly, said Mr.
sentences.chinese: 休森说，杜鹃鸟表面的愚蠢背后是不可改变的逻辑。

sentences.english: Gowk is another name for a cuckoo bird.
sentences.chinese: “杜鹃鸟”是“布谷鸟”的另一种叫法。

sentences.english: Second, the emotional imagery implication of cuckoo.
sentences.chinese: 杜鹃鸟意象的情感意蕴。

sentences.english: In England the cuckoo is a herald of spring.
sentences.chinese: 在英国杜鹃鸟是春天的预告。

definition: the cuckoo cries blood/fig. plaintive lament
cuckoo (Cercococcyx spp.)/same as 杜鵑鳥|杜鹃鸟[du4 juan1 niao3]
(bird species of China) common cuckoo (Cuculus canorus)
(bird species of China) Indian cuckoo (Cuculus micropterus)
to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
(bird species of China) great reed warbler (Acrocephalus arundinaceus)
